Yao
Basic explanation of words
Yao
y√°o
The long and short horizontal roads that make up each hexagram in the eight hexagrams: Yaoxiang (a. the image of the hexagram; b. the image of the hexagram, the truth).
Yao
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªy√°oÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Hu Mao cut, flat dish, box. ]
(1) The symbols that make up the hexagrams in Zhouyi. "-" means yang line, "--" means yin line. Every three hexagrams are combined into one hexagram, and eight hexagrams can be obtained, which is called Jing hexagram; if two hexagrams (six hexagrams) are heavy, sixty-four hexagrams are obtained, called other hexagrams. The line contains the meaning of interleaving and change.
(2) The name of the province.
Yao
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Centralized Collection] [Department of Yao Characters] „ÄÄ Yao; Kangxi Strokes: 4; Page Number: Page 690 13
[Tang Yun] Hu Maoqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] What cross-cutting, sound delicacy. [Said Wen] Hand in too. Like Yi Liuyao to hand over. „ÄêYi¬∑Cici„ÄëYao are those who change. Those who are also Yaoyao. Those who follow suit. Those who are also Yaoyao. Those who follow the world's movers are also.„ÄÄ[Jiyun] After cutting, the sound is sweet. This works effectively. Like also. One said merit. Or effective. Pass as a fool. [Zheng Yun] Yi, the method of Yao is Kun. Lu Yin Hu Xiaoqie, according to the new text of the Yi system.
